docs.lead_paragraph: Arizona Governor Jan Brewer on Tuesday signed into a law a bill allowing state health authorities to conduct surprise inspections of abortion clinics without first obtaining a warrant, handing another victory to abortion foes.

headline.main: Bill Signed Allowing Surprise Inspections of Arizona Abortion Clinics
headline.print_headline: Bill Signed Allowing Surprise Inspections of Arizona Abortion Clinics

docs.snippet: Arizona Governor Jan Brewer on Tuesday signed into a law a bill allowing state health authorities to conduct surprise inspections of abortion clinics without first obtaining a warrant, handing another victory to abortion foes.

docs.lead_paragraph: A high-tech screening tool for cervical cancer is facing pushback from more than a dozen patient groups, who warn that the genetic test could displace a simpler, cheaper and more established mainstay of women's health: the Pap smear.

headline.main: DNA Alternative to Pap Smear Sparks Medical Debate
headline.print_headline: DNA Alternative to Pap Smear Sparks Medical Debate

docs.snippet: A high-tech screening tool for cervical cancer is facing pushback from more than a dozen patient groups, who warn that the genetic test could displace a simpler, cheaper and more established mainstay of women's health: the Pap smear.

headline.main: The Decision: One Child, One School

docs.abstract: Parents are notoriously anxious yet clueless with their first child. With the preschool decision, I felt additional pressure because after a recent ectopic pregnancy, it looks as if Zee will be our only child.
docs.snippet: Parents are notoriously anxious yet clueless with their first child. With the preschool decision, I felt additional pressure because after a recent ectopic pregnancy, it looks as if Zee will be our only child.

docs.lead_paragraph: Health authorities said any risks of narcotics to newborns have been exaggerated, and if withdrawal symptoms do occur, they can be treated without any long-term effects.

headline.main: Specialists Join Call for Veto of Drug Bill
headline.print_headline: Drug Bill Covering Pregnancy Gains Foes

docs.abstract: Women's rights and medical groups are calling on Tennessee Gov BIll Haslam to veto legislation that will allow criminal assault charges to be filed against women who use illegal drugs during pregnancy; critics say measure will harm babies because pregnant women will be afraid to seek medical care.
docs.snippet: Health authorities said any risks of narcotics to newborns have been exaggerated, and if withdrawal symptoms do occur, they can be treated without any long-term effects.

docs.lead_paragraph: Despite guidelines declaring vaginal births after previous cesareans to be safe, many hospitals do not perform them for fear of complications.
docs.abstract: Many hospitals refuse to perform vaginal births after mother has already had cesarean section, fearing complications; policy, predominant in rural areas, persists despite national push to reduce cesareans; proscription upsets many women who want to give birth vaginally, and are subsequently forced to travel long distances to give birth the way they choose.
docs.snippet: Despite guidelines declaring vaginal births after previous cesareans to be safe, many hospitals do not perform them for fear of complications.

docs.lead_paragraph: More pregnant women are being prescribed opioid painkillers, whose risks to fetuses are unknown, a move that surprises some doctors and researchers.

headline.main: Surge in Narcotic Prescriptions for Pregnant Women
headline.print_headline: Surge in Narcotic Prescriptions for Pregnant Women

docs.abstract: Research published in journal Obstetrics & Gynecology shows that doctors are prescribing painkillers to pregnant women in astonishing numbers, with nearly 23 percent of pregnant women filling opioid prescriptions in 2007, up from 18.5 percent in 2000; risks to developing fetus are largely unknown, raising concern among many health providers.
docs.snippet: More pregnant women are being prescribed opioid painkillers, whose risks to fetuses are unknown, a move that surprises some doctors and researchers.
